subject: Politics
title: Social Media and Democracy
description: A 60-second lesson on Social Media and Democracy.

hook.text: Social media was supposed to democratize information. It also democratized lies, hate, and manipulation.

buildup.text: Platforms like Facebook, X, and YouTube let anyone publish to millions. Gatekeepers vanished overnight.

discovery.text: Social media helped organize the Arab Spring and #MeToo. It gives voice to people traditional media ignores.

twist.text: Algorithms favor outrage because anger drives engagement. The platforms profit from division.

climax.text: Social media fragments the public sphere. Instead of one shared conversation, millions talk past each other.

punchline.text: Social media gave everyone a voice. It didn't give everyone the truth.

quiz.question: Why do social media algorithms tend to promote outrage?
options: Anger drives higher engagement which increases platform profits
Platforms are required by law to show angry content first
Algorithms randomly select content with no pattern
